meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Fred Vaughn Demi Hueth Kyle Webb Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7220.

td.p: Fred Vaughn, an Internet operations technician from Mineral Point, Wisconsin
Demi Hueth, a law student from New York, New York
Kyle Webb, a veterinary clinical pathologist originally from Boyertown, Pennsylvania (whose 3-day cash winnings total $45,200)

div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'A schwa is an unstressed "uh" sound like the one at the start of this military posture

ə \'ten')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
A schwa is an unstressed "uh" sound like the one at the start of this military posture
ə 'ten

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', '(Kyle: What are photographs?)
(Fred: What are snapshots?)

slides

KyleDemiFred
')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_4_1', 'clue_J_4_1_stuck', '[Demi loses the buzzer race to Kyle.]
(Alex: Demi.)
(Demi: Who are [*]?)
(Alex: [Interrupting] I--I\'m sorry. Kyle.)
(Kyle: Who are [*]?)
[Demi was credited with a correct response at the first break.]

The Eurythmics

KyleDemi
')

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):
Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: (Dr. Jen Arnold: I'm Dr. Jen Arnold, and we're using high-tech simulations to improve teamwork and reduce error at...)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Fred: [Exhales slowly] What is hypoxia?)
...
(Alex: So you\'re now in a tie with Kyle. And I want to thank Dr. Arnold. She was really good on those clues. Darn. I\'m gonna start worrying about my job.)

anaphylactic shock

Fred
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Dr. Arnold delivers the clue.) Simulations are so realistic that in one scenario apparent respiratory distress helps team members learn to distinguish between an asthma attack & this allergen-induced condition in which blood pressure & oxygen levels drop, requiring emergency response')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Dr. Arnold delivers the clue.) Simulations are so realistic that in one scenario apparent respiratory distress helps team members learn to distinguish between an asthma attack & this allergen-induced condition in which blood pressure & oxygen levels drop, requiring emergency response

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Fred] Who would\'ve thunk it after that first round today? But he turned everything around. Well done.)
DemiWhat the Battle of Thermopalye
$3,200
FredWhat is the Battle of Thermopylae?
$6,000
KyleWhat is Mt. Vesuvius?
$10,000
the Battle of Thermopylae')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Pantites, sent to recruit troops, & Aristodemus, sent off to treat his eye disease, were the only known Greeks to survive this event')

tr.td: Pantites, sent to recruit troops, & Aristodemus, sent off to treat his eye disease, were the only known Greeks to survive this event

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
